what: General checker for parameter-specific logical rules — check_logical_parameter
title: General checker for parameter-specific logical rules — check_logical_parameter
text: function checks logical rule violations benthos/epibenthos data applying user-defined condition values given parameter. intended replace old family check_*_*_logical() functions.

title: General checker for parameter-specific logical rules — check_logical_parameter
code: check_logical_parameter(   data,   param_name,   condition,   return_df = FALSE,   return_logical = FALSE )

title: General checker for parameter-specific logical rules — check_logical_parameter
text: data data frame. Must contain columns parameter value. param_name Character; name parameter check. condition function takes numeric vector values returns logical vector (TRUE rows considered problematic). return_df Logical. TRUE, return plain data.frame problematic rows. return_logical Logical. TRUE, return logical vector length nrow(data). Overrides return_df.

title: General checker for parameter-specific logical rules — check_logical_parameter
text: DT datatable, data.frame, logical vector, NULL problems found.

title: General checker for parameter-specific logical rules — check_logical_parameter
code: # Example dataset df <- dplyr::tibble(   station_name = c("A1", "A2", "A3", "A4"),   sample_date = as.Date("2023-05-01") + 0:3,   sample_id = 101:104,   parameter = c("Biomass", "Biomass", "Abundance", "Biomass"),   value = c(5, -2, 10, 0) )  # 1. Check that Biomass is never negative check_logical_parameter(df, "Biomass", function(x) x < 0,  return_df = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 1 × 5 #>   station_name sample_date sample_id parameter value #>   <chr>        <date>          <int> <chr>     <dbl> #> 1 A2           2023-05-02        102 Biomass      -2  # 2. Same check, but return problematic rows as a data frame check_logical_parameter(df, "Biomass", function(x) x < 0, return_df = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 1 × 5 #>   station_name sample_date sample_id parameter value #>   <chr>        <date>          <int> <chr>     <dbl> #> 1 A2           2023-05-02        102 Biomass      -2  # 3. Return logical vector marking problematic rows check_logical_parameter(df, "Biomass", function(x) x < 0, return_logical = TRUE) #> [1] FALSE  TRUE FALSE FALSE  # 4. Check that Abundance is not zero (no problems found -> returns NULL) abundance_check <- check_logical_parameter(df, "Abundance", function(x) x == 0) print(abundance_check) #> NULL

what: Check if stations are reported as nominal positions — check_nominal_station
title: Check if stations are reported as nominal positions — check_nominal_station
text: function attempts determine whether stations dataset reported using nominal positions (.e., generic repeated coordinates across events), rather actual measured coordinates.

title: Check if stations are reported as nominal positions — check_nominal_station
code: check_nominal_station(data, verbose = TRUE)

title: Check if stations are reported as nominal positions — check_nominal_station
text: data data frame containing least columns: sample_date, station_name, sample_longitude_dd, sample_latitude_dd. verbose Logical. TRUE, messages displayed execution. Defaults TRUE.

title: Check if stations are reported as nominal positions — check_nominal_station
text: data frame distinct station names corresponding latitude/longitude positions, nominal positions suspected. Otherwise, returns NULL.

title: Check if stations are reported as nominal positions — check_nominal_station
text: function compares number unique sampling dates number unique station coordinates. number unique sampling dates larger number unique station coordinates, function suspects nominal station positions issues warning.

title: Check if stations are reported as nominal positions — check_nominal_station
code: df <- data.frame(   sample_date = rep(seq.Date(Sys.Date(), by = "day", length.out = 3), each = 2),   station_name = rep(c("ST1", "ST2"), 3),   sample_longitude_dd = rep(c(15.0, 16.0), 3),   sample_latitude_dd = rep(c(58.5, 58.6), 3) ) check_nominal_station(df) #> WARNING: Suspected nominal positions reported! Is this correct? #>   STATION LON  LAT #> 1     ST1  15 58.5 #> 2     ST2  16 58.6

what: Check whether points are located on land — check_onland
title: Check whether points are located on land — check_onland
text: Identifies records whose coordinates fall land, optionally applying buffer allow points near coast.

title: Check whether points are located on land — check_onland
code: check_onland(   data,   land = NULL,   report = FALSE,   buffer = 0,   offline = FALSE,   plot_leaflet = FALSE,   only_bad = FALSE )

title: Check whether points are located on land — check_onland
text: data data frame containing least sample_longitude_dd sample_latitude_dd. columns must numeric, within valid ranges (longitude: -180 180, latitude: -90 90), use WGS84 coordinates (EPSG:4326). land Optional sf object containing land polygons. Used offline mode. report Logical; TRUE, returns tibble listing rows land warnings. FALSE (default), returns subset data containing records land. buffer Numeric; distance meters inland points still considered valid. used online mode. Default 0. offline Logical; TRUE, function uses local cached shoreline (available). FALSE (default), OBIS web service queried. plot_leaflet Logical; TRUE, returns leaflet map showing points colored whether land (red) water (green). Default FALSE. only_bad Logical; TRUE plot_leaflet = TRUE, points land (red) plotted. Default FALSE, meaning points plotted.

title: Check whether points are located on land — check_onland
text: report = TRUE, tibble columns: field: always NA (placeholder future extension) level: "warning" flagged rows row: row numbers data flagged located land message: description issue report = FALSE plot_leaflet = FALSE, returns subset data flagged rows. plot_leaflet = TRUE, returns leaflet map showing points land (red) water (green), unless only_bad = TRUE, case red points plotted.

title: Check whether points are located on land — check_onland
text: function supports offline online modes: Offline mode (offline = TRUE): uses local simplified shoreline cached geopackage (land.gpkg). file exist, downloaded automatically cached across R sessions. Online mode (offline = FALSE): uses OBIS web service determine distance shore. function assumes coordinates WGS84 (EPSG:4326). Supplying coordinates different CRS result incorrect intersection tests. Optionally, leaflet map can plotted. Points land displayed red markers, points water green. only_bad = TRUE, red points (land) plotted.

title: Check whether points are located on land — check_onland
code: # Example data frame with coordinates example_data <- data.frame(   sample_latitude_dd = c(59.3, 58.1, 57.5),   sample_longitude_dd = c(18.6, 17.5, 16.7) )  # Report points on land with a 100 m buffer report <- check_onland(example_data, report = TRUE, buffer = 100) print(report) #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   field level     row message                         #>   <lgl> <chr>   <int> <chr>                           #> 1 NA    warning     1 Coordinates are located on land  # Plot all points colored by land/water map <- check_onland(example_data, plot_leaflet = TRUE)  # Plot only bad points on land map_bad <- check_onland(example_data, plot_leaflet = TRUE, only_bad = TRUE)  # Remove points on land by adding a buffer of 2000 m ok <- check_onland(example_data, report = FALSE, buffer = 2000) print(nrow(ok)) #> [1] 0

what: General outlier check function for SHARK data — check_outliers
title: General outlier check function for SHARK data — check_outliers
text: function checks whether values specified parameter exceed predefined threshold. Thresholds provided dataframe (default .threshold_values), contain columns parameter, datatype, least one numeric threshold column (e.g., extreme_upper). rows data matching parameter delivery_datatype (datatype) considered. Optionally, data can grouped custom column (e.g., location_sea_basin) thresholds vary group.

title: General outlier check function for SHARK data — check_outliers
code: check_outliers(   data,   parameter,   datatype,   threshold_col = "extreme_upper",   thresholds = .threshold_values,   custom_group = NULL,   direction = c("above", "below"),   return_df = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: General outlier check function for SHARK data — check_outliers
text: data tibble containing data SHARK format. Must include columns: parameter, value, delivery_datatype, station_name, sample_date, sample_id, shark_sample_id_md5, sample_min_depth_m, sample_max_depth_m, custom grouping column used custom_group. parameter Character. Name parameter check. Must exist data$parameter thresholds$parameter. datatype Character. Data type match delivery_datatype data datatype thresholds. threshold_col Character. Name threshold column thresholds use comparison. Defaults "extreme_upper". columns (e.g., "min", "Q1", "median", "max", "mild_upper", etc.) can also used present. thresholds tibble/data frame thresholds. Must include columns parameter, datatype, least one numeric threshold column. Defaults .threshold_values. custom_group Character NULL. Optional column name data thresholds grouping (e.g., "location_sea_basin"). specified, thresholds matched group well parameter datatype. direction Character. Either "" (flag values threshold) "" (flag values threshold). Default "". return_df Logical. TRUE, returns plain data.frame flagged rows instead DT datatable. Default = FALSE. verbose Logical. TRUE, messages displayed execution. Defaults TRUE.

title: General outlier check function for SHARK data — check_outliers
text: outliers found, returns DT::datatable data.frame (return_df = TRUE) containing: datatype, station_name, sample_date, sample_id, parameter, value, threshold, custom_group specified. Otherwise, prints message indicating values within threshold range (verbose = TRUE) returns invisible(NULL).

title: General outlier check function for SHARK data — check_outliers
text: rows data matching parameter delivery_datatype checked. custom_group specified, thresholds applied per group. threshold_col exist thresholds, function stops warning. Values exceeding () threshold flagged outliers. Intended interactive use Shiny apps threshold_col can selected dynamically.

title: General outlier check function for SHARK data — check_outliers
code: # Minimal example dataset example_data <- dplyr::tibble(   station_name = c("S1", "S2"),   sample_date = as.Date(c("2025-01-01", "2025-01-02")),   sample_id = 1:2,   shark_sample_id_md5 = letters[1:2],   sample_min_depth_m = c(0, 5),   sample_max_depth_m = c(1, 6),   parameter = c("Param1", "Param1"),   value = c(5, 12),   delivery_datatype = c("TypeA", "TypeA") )  example_thresholds <- dplyr::tibble(   parameter = "Param1",   datatype = "TypeA",   extreme_upper = 10,   mild_upper = 8 )  # Check for values above "extreme_upper" check_outliers(   data = example_data,   parameter = "Param1",   datatype = "TypeA",   threshold_col = "extreme_upper",   thresholds = example_thresholds,   return_df = TRUE ) #> WARNING: Param1 ( TypeA ) exceeds extreme_upper in dataset #> # A tibble: 1 × 7 #>   delivery_datatype station_name sample_date sample_id parameter value threshold #>   <chr>             <chr>        <date>          <int> <chr>     <dbl>     <dbl> #> 1 TypeA             S2           2025-01-02          2 Param1       12        10  # Check for values above "mild_upper" check_outliers(   data = example_data,   parameter = "Param1",   datatype = "TypeA",   threshold_col = "mild_upper",   thresholds = example_thresholds,   return_df = TRUE ) #> WARNING: Param1 ( TypeA ) exceeds mild_upper in dataset #> # A tibble: 1 × 7 #>   delivery_datatype station_name sample_date sample_id parameter value threshold #>   <chr>             <chr>        <date>          <int> <chr>     <dbl>     <dbl> #> 1 TypeA             S2           2025-01-02          2 Param1       12         8

what: Check parameter values against logical rules — check_parameter_rules
title: Check parameter values against logical rules — check_parameter_rules
text: Applies parameter-specific row-wise logical rules benthos/epibenthos data, flagging measurements violate defined conditions. function replaces multiple deprecated check_*_logical() functions general, flexible implementation.

title: Check parameter values against logical rules — check_parameter_rules
code: check_parameter_rules(   data,   param_conditions = get(".param_conditions", envir = asNamespace("SHARK4R")),   rowwise_conditions = get(".rowwise_conditions", envir = asNamespace("SHARK4R")),   return_df = FALSE,   return_logical = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Check parameter values against logical rules — check_parameter_rules
text: data data frame containing least columns parameter value. param_conditions named list parameter-specific rules. element list : condition Function taking numeric vector returning logical vector (TRUE = violation). range_msg Character string describing expected range. Defaults SHARK4R:::.param_conditions defined package namespace. rowwise_conditions named list row-wise rules applied across multiple parameters. element function taking full data frame returning logical vector. Defaults SHARK4R:::.rowwise_conditions defined package namespace. return_df Logical. TRUE, problematic rows returned plain data.frames. return_logical Logical. TRUE, problematic rows returned logical vectors. Overrides return_df. verbose Logical. TRUE, messages displayed execution. Defaults TRUE.

title: Check parameter values against logical rules — check_parameter_rules
text: named list results parameter: Logical vector return_logical = TRUE. Data frame return_df = TRUE violations exist. DT datatable violations exist return_df = FALSE. NULL violations exist parameter. Invisible return.

title: Check parameter values against logical rules — check_parameter_rules
text: function evaluates parameter param_conditions rowwise_conditions. parameters present dataset checked. Messages printed indicating whether values within expected ranges rows violate rules.

title: Check parameter values against logical rules — check_parameter_rules
code: df <- data.frame(   station_name = c("A1", "A2", "A3", "A4"),   sample_date = as.Date("2023-05-01") + 0:3,   sample_id = 101:104,   parameter = c("Wet weight", "Wet weight", "Abundance", "BQIm"),   value = c(0, 5, 0, 3) )  # Check against default package rules check_parameter_rules(df) #> Parameter Wet weight, measurement(s) outside expected range: > 0 #> Parameter BQIm, row-wise logical check failed  # Return problematic rows as data.frame check_parameter_rules(df, return_df = TRUE) #> Parameter Wet weight, measurement(s) outside expected range: > 0 #> Parameter BQIm, row-wise logical check failed  # Return logical vectors for each parameter rule_check <- check_parameter_rules(df, return_logical = TRUE) print(rule_check) #> $`Wet weight` #> [1]  TRUE FALSE FALSE FALSE #>  #> $BQIm #> [1] FALSE FALSE  TRUE  TRUE #>

what: Download and set up SHARK4R support files — check_setup
title: Download and set up SHARK4R support files — check_setup
text: function downloads products folder SHARK4R GitHub repository places user-specified directory. folders contain Shiny applications R Markdown documents used quality control (QC) SHARK data.

title: Download and set up SHARK4R support files — check_setup
code: check_setup(path, run_app = FALSE, force = FALSE, verbose = TRUE)

title: Download and set up SHARK4R support files — check_setup
text: path Character string giving directory products folder created. Must provided user. run_app Logical, TRUE runs QC Shiny app located products folder setup. Default FALSE. force Logical, TRUE forces re-download overwrites existing folder. Default FALSE. verbose Logical, TRUE prints progress messages. Default TRUE.

title: Download and set up SHARK4R support files — check_setup
text: (invisible) list path local products folder:

title: Download and set up SHARK4R support files — check_setup
text: path folders already exist, download skipped unless force = TRUE specified. Optionally, function can launch QC Shiny app directly setup.

title: Download and set up SHARK4R support files — check_setup
code: # \donttest{ # Download support files into a temporary directory check_setup(path = tempdir()) #> Downloading setup files for SHARK4R... #> Setup complete. Files are available in /tmp/RtmpWnWKWd  # Force re-download if already present check_setup(path = tempdir(), force = TRUE) #> Downloading setup files for SHARK4R... #> Setup complete. Files are available in /tmp/RtmpWnWKWd  # Download and run the QC Shiny app if(interactive()){  check_setup(path = tempdir(), run_app = TRUE) } # }

what: Check station distances against SMHI station list — check_station_distance
title: Check station distances against SMHI station list — check_station_distance
text: Matches reported station names SMHI curated station list ("station.txt") checks whether matched stations fall within pre-defined distance limits. helps ensure station assignments spatially consistent.

title: Check station distances against SMHI station list — check_station_distance
code: check_station_distance(   data,   station_file = NULL,   plot_leaflet = FALSE,   try_synonyms = TRUE,   fallback_crs = 4326,   only_bad = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Check station distances against SMHI station list — check_station_distance
text: data data frame containing least columns: station_name, sample_longitude_dd, sample_latitude_dd. station_file Optional path custom station file (tab-delimited). NULL (default), function first attempt use NODC_CONFIG environment variable, fails, use bundled "station.zip" SHARK4R package. plot_leaflet Logical; TRUE, displays leaflet map SMHI stations (blue circles radius popup) reported stations (green/red/gray markers). Default FALSE. try_synonyms Logical; TRUE (default), unmatched station names also compared SYNONYM_NAMES column station database. fallback_crs Integer; CRS (EPSG code) use creating spatial points CRS available. Defaults 4326 (WGS84). Change coordinates reported another CRS (e.g., 3006 SWEREF99 TM). only_bad Logical; TRUE, leaflet map display stations outside allowed radius (red markers). Default FALSE. verbose Logical. TRUE, messages displayed execution. Defaults TRUE.

title: Check station distances against SMHI station list — check_station_distance
text: plot_leaflet = FALSE, returns data frame columns: station_name Reported station name. match_type TRUE station matched SMHI list, FALSE otherwise. distance_m Distance meters reported station matched SMHI station. within_limit TRUE distance <= allowed radius, FALSE outside, NA unmatched. plot_leaflet = TRUE, function produces leaflet map showing: Blue circles SMHI stations radius popup. Reported stations colored status: green (within radius), red (outside radius), gray (unmatched). only_bad = TRUE, red stations (outside radius) displayed.

title: Check station distances against SMHI station list — check_station_distance
text: Optionally, leaflet map stations can plotted. SMHI stations match reported data shown blue circles, allowed radius visualized displayed popup (e.g., "ST1 (Radius: 1000 m)"). Reported stations shown markers colored whether fall within radius (green), outside radius (red), unmatched (gray). try_synonyms = TRUE, function attempt second match using SYNONYM_NAMES column station database, splitting multiple synonyms separated <>. function first checks station file path provided via station_file argument. , looks NODC_CONFIG environment variable. variable can point folder NODC (Swedish National Oceanographic Data Center) configuration station file stored, typically including: <NODC_CONFIG>/config/station.txt NODC_CONFIG set folder exists, function use station.txt location. Otherwise, falls back bundled station.zip included SHARK4R package.

title: Check station distances against SMHI station list — check_station_distance
code: # Example data df <- data.frame(   station_name = c("ANHOLT E", "BY5 BORNHOLMSDJ", "NEW STATION"),   sample_longitude_dd = c(12.1, 15.97, 17.5),   sample_latitude_dd  = c(56.7, 55.25, 58.7) )  # Check station distance check_station_distance(df, try_synonyms = TRUE, verbose = FALSE) #>      station_name sample_longitude_dd sample_latitude_dd distance_m #> 1        ANHOLT E               12.10              56.70  3551.0004 #> 2 BY5 BORNHOLMSDJ               15.97              55.25   898.1066 #> 3     NEW STATION               17.50              58.70         NA #>   within_limit #> 1        FALSE #> 2         TRUE #> 3           NA  # Plot bad points in leaflet map map <- check_station_distance(df,                               plot_leaflet = TRUE,                               only_bad = TRUE,                               verbose = FALSE)

what: Identify non-numeric or non-logical values in measurement data — check_value_logical
title: Identify non-numeric or non-logical values in measurement data — check_value_logical
text: function checks whether entries value column dataset valid numeric logical values. particularly useful identifying common data entry errors inequality symbols (<, >) unintended text strings (e.g., "NA", "detection"). function reports invalid entries interactive DT::datatable easy inspection.

title: Identify non-numeric or non-logical values in measurement data — check_value_logical
code: check_value_logical(data, return_df = FALSE)

title: Identify non-numeric or non-logical values in measurement data — check_value_logical
text: data data frame. Must contain column named value. return_df Logical. TRUE, return plain data.frame problematic rows instead DT datatable. Default = FALSE.

title: Identify non-numeric or non-logical values in measurement data — check_value_logical
text: DT::datatable data frame listing unique invalid entries, NULL (invisibly) values correctly formatted numeric logical.

title: Identify non-numeric or non-logical values in measurement data — check_value_logical
code: # Example dataset with mixed valid and invalid values df <- data.frame(   station_name = c("A", "B", "C", "D", "E"),   value = c("3.4", "<0.2", "TRUE", "NA", "5e-3") )  # Check for invalid (non-numeric / non-logical) entries check_value_logical(df, return_df = TRUE) #> ERROR: Expected numerical/logical value but found invalid characters. #> Common problems are e.g. '<', '>' signs, text labels, or malformed numbers. #>   value #> 1  <0.2 #> 2    NA  # Example with all valid numeric and logical values df_valid <- data.frame(value = c(1.2, 0, TRUE, FALSE, 3.5)) check_value_logical(df_valid) #> All values are correctly formatted as numeric or logical.

TRUE, return plain data.frame problematic rows instead DT datatable. Default = FALSE. return_logical Logical. title: Clean SHARK4R cache by file age and session — clean_shark4r_cache
text: Deletes cached files SHARK4R cache directory older specified number days.

title: Clean SHARK4R cache by file age and session — clean_shark4r_cache
code: clean_shark4r_cache(   days = 1,   cache_dir = tools::R_user_dir("SHARK4R", "cache"),   clear_perm_cache = FALSE,   search_pattern = NULL,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Clean SHARK4R cache by file age and session — clean_shark4r_cache
text: days Numeric; remove files older number days. Default 1. cache_dir Character; path cache directory clean. Defaults SHARK4R cache directory user-specific R folder (via tools::R_user_dir("SHARK4R", "cache")). can override parameter custom cache locations. clear_perm_cache Logical. TRUE, filed cached across R sessions cleared, .e. geographical shape files. Defaults FALSE. search_pattern Character; optional regex pattern filter files consider deletion. verbose Logical. TRUE, displays messages cache cleaning progress. Defaults TRUE.

what: Construct a hierarchical taxonomy table from Dyntaxa — construct_dyntaxa_table
title: Construct a hierarchical taxonomy table from Dyntaxa — construct_dyntaxa_table
text: function constructs taxonomy table based Dyntaxa taxon IDs. queries SLU Artdatabanken API (Dyntaxa) fetch taxonomy information organizes data hierarchical table.

title: Construct a hierarchical taxonomy table from Dyntaxa — construct_dyntaxa_table
code: construct_dyntaxa_table(   taxon_ids,   subscription_key = Sys.getenv("DYNTAXA_KEY"),   shark_output = TRUE,   add_parents = TRUE,   add_descendants = FALSE,   add_descendants_rank = "genus",   add_synonyms = TRUE,   add_missing_taxa = FALSE,   add_hierarchy = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE,   add_genus_children = deprecated(),   recommended_only = deprecated(),   parent_ids = deprecated() )

title: Construct a hierarchical taxonomy table from Dyntaxa — construct_dyntaxa_table
text: taxon_ids integer vector containing taxon IDs taxonomy information requested. IDs correspond specific taxonomic entities within Dyntaxa database. subscription_key Dyntaxa API subscription key. default, key read environment variable DYNTAXA_KEY. can provide key three ways: Directly parameter: construct_dyntaxa_table(238366, subscription_key = "your_key_here"). Temporarily session: Sys.setenv(DYNTAXA_KEY = "your_key_here"). , need pass subscription_key function. Permanently across sessions adding ~/.Renviron file. Use usethis::edit_r_environ() open file, add: DYNTAXA_KEY=your_key_here. , need pass subscription_key function. shark_output Logical. TRUE, function return table formatted SHARK-compatible columns. FALSE, available columns returned. Default TRUE. add_parents Logical. TRUE, function include parent taxa (higher ranks) specified taxon IDs output. Default TRUE. add_descendants Logical. TRUE, output include descendant taxa (lower ranks) specified taxon IDs rank specified add_descendants_rank. Default FALSE. add_descendants_rank Character string specifying rank descendant taxa include. Allowed values "kingdom", "phylum", "class", "order", "family", "genus", "species". Default "genus". add_synonyms Logical. TRUE, function include synonyms accepted taxa output. Default TRUE. add_missing_taxa Logical. TRUE, function attempt fetch missing taxa (.e., taxa found initial Dyntaxa DwC-query, species complexes). Default FALSE. add_hierarchy Logical. TRUE, function add hierarchy column indicating taxonomic relationships (e.g., parent-child) among taxa. Default FALSE. verbose Logical. TRUE, function print additional messages provide feedback progress. Default TRUE. add_genus_children Use add_descendants instead. recommended_only Use add_synonyms instead. parent_ids Use taxon_ids instead. construct_dyntaxa_table now handles taxon IDs.

title: Construct a hierarchical taxonomy table from Dyntaxa — construct_dyntaxa_table
text: data frame representing constructed taxonomy table.

title: Construct a hierarchical taxonomy table from Dyntaxa — construct_dyntaxa_table
text: valid Dyntaxa API subscription key required. can request free key "Taxonomy" service ArtDatabanken API portal: https://api-portal.artdatabanken.se/ Note: Please review API conditions register access using API. Data collected API stored SLU Artdatabanken. Please also note authors SHARK4R affiliated SLU Artdatabanken.

title: Construct a hierarchical taxonomy table from Dyntaxa — construct_dyntaxa_table
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Construct Dyntaxa taxonomy table for taxon IDs 238366 and 1010380 taxon_ids <- c(238366, 1010380) taxonomy_table <- construct_dyntaxa_table(taxon_ids, "your_subscription_key") print(taxonomy_table) } # }

what: Convert coordinates from DDMM format to decimal degrees — convert_ddmm_to_dd
title: Convert coordinates from DDMM format to decimal degrees — convert_ddmm_to_dd
text: function converts geographic coordinates provided DDMM format (degrees minutes) decimal degrees. can handle: DDMM (e.g., 5733 57°33' 57.55°) DDMMss DDMMss… (extra digits minutes interpreted fractional minutes, e.g., 573345 57°33.45' 57.5575°)

title: Convert coordinates from DDMM format to decimal degrees — convert_ddmm_to_dd
code: convert_ddmm_to_dd(coord)

title: Convert coordinates from DDMM format to decimal degrees — convert_ddmm_to_dd
text: coord numeric character vector coordinates DDMM format.

title: Convert coordinates from DDMM format to decimal degrees — convert_ddmm_to_dd
text: numeric vector decimal degrees corresponding input coordinates. Names input vector removed.

title: Convert coordinates from DDMM format to decimal degrees — convert_ddmm_to_dd
text: Non-numeric characters removed conversion. Coordinates shorter 4 digits returned NA.

title: Convert coordinates from DDMM format to decimal degrees — convert_ddmm_to_dd
code: # Basic DDMM input convert_ddmm_to_dd(c(5733, 6045)) #> [1] 57.55 60.75 # Input with fractional minutes convert_ddmm_to_dd(c("573345", "604523")) #> [1] 57.55750 60.75383 # Input with non-numeric characters convert_ddmm_to_dd(c("57°33'", "60°45'23\"")) #> [1] 57.55000 60.75383

text: functions deprecated made defunct. known replacement, calling function tell .

title: Defunct functions — defunct

what: Find required fields in a SHARK delivery template — find_required_fields
title: Find required fields in a SHARK delivery template — find_required_fields
text: Identifies columns mandatory SHARK delivery template based rows starting "*" (one ). can specify many levels asterisks include.

title: Find required fields in a SHARK delivery template — find_required_fields
code: find_required_fields(   datatype,   stars = 1,   bacterioplankton_subtype = "abundance" )

title: Find required fields in a SHARK delivery template — find_required_fields
text: datatype Character. datatype name. Available options include: "Bacterioplankton" (subtypes: "abundance", "production") "Chlorophyll" "Epibenthos" (dive transect) "Dropvideo" (epibenthos drop video) "Grey seal" "Harbour seal" "Ringed seal" "Harbour Porpoise" "Physical Chemical" "Primary production" "Phytoplankton" "Picoplankton" "Sedimentation" "Seal pathology" "Profile" "Zooplankton" "Zoobenthos" stars Integer. Maximum number "" levels include. Default = 1 (single ""). example, stars = 2 includes "" "**", stars = 3 includes "", "", "*". bacterioplankton_subtype Character. "Bacterioplankton" : either "abundance" (default) "production". Ignored datatypes.

title: Find required fields in a SHARK delivery template — find_required_fields
text: character vector column names required template.

title: Find required fields in a SHARK delivery template — find_required_fields
text: Note: single "*" marks required fields standard SHARK template. double "**" often used specify columns required national monitoring . information, see: https://www.smhi.se/data/hav-och-havsmiljo/datavardskap-oceanografi-och-marinbiologi/leverera-data

title: Find required fields in a SHARK delivery template — find_required_fields
code: # \donttest{ # Only single "*" required columns find_required_fields("Bacterioplankton") #>  [1] "MYEAR"    "STATN"    "PROJ"     "ORDERER"  "SHIPC"    "SDATE"    #>  [7] "LATIT"    "LONGI"    "POSYS"    "WADEP"    "SMPDEP"   "SLABO"    #> [13] "ACKR_SMP" "SMTYP"    "SMVOL"    "SPVOL"    "COEFF"    "SUBNO"    #> [19] "METFP"    "BCTCNT"   "BCTABU"   "BABUFLG"  "BACTBIOM" "ALABO"    #> [25] "ACKR_ANA" "ANADATE"  "METDC"     # Include both "*" and "**" required columns (national monitoring too) find_required_fields("Bacterioplankton", stars = 2) #>  [1] "MYEAR"    "STATN"    "PROJ"     "ORDERER"  "SHIPC"    "SDATE"    #>  [7] "LATIT"    "LONGI"    "POSYS"    "WADEP"    "MPROG"    "SMPDEP"   #> [13] "SLABO"    "ACKR_SMP" "SMTYP"    "SMVOL"    "SPVOL"    "COEFF"    #> [19] "SUBNO"    "METFP"    "BCTCNT"   "BCTABU"   "BABUFLG"  "BACTBIOM" #> [25] "ALABO"    "ACKR_ANA" "ANADATE"  "METDC"     # Include up to three levels of "*" find_required_fields("Phytoplankton", stars = 3) #>  [1] "MYEAR"    "STATN"    "PROJ"     "ORDERER"  "SHIPC"    "SDATE"    #>  [7] "LATIT"    "LONGI"    "POSYS"    "WADEP"    "MSTAT"    "MNDEP"    #> [13] "MXDEP"    "SLABO"    "ACKR_SMP" "SMTYP"    "SMVOL"    "LATNM"    #> [19] "SFLAG"    "TRPHY"    "COUNT"    "COEFF"    "SIZCL"    "SIZRF"    #> [25] "SDVOL"    "QFLAG"    "TAXNM"    "METOA"    "ALABO"    "ACKR_ANA" #> [31] "ANADATE"  "METDC"    # }

what: Search AlgaeBase for information about a genus of algae — get_algaebase_genus
title: Search AlgaeBase for information about a genus of algae — get_algaebase_genus
text: function deprecated. Users encouraged use match_algaebase_species instead. function searches AlgaeBase API genus information returns detailed taxonomic data, including higher taxonomy, taxonomic status, scientific names, related metadata.

title: Search AlgaeBase for information about a genus of algae — get_algaebase_genus
code: get_algaebase_genus(   genus,   subscription_key = Sys.getenv("ALGAEBASE_KEY"),   higher = TRUE,   unparsed = FALSE,   newest_only = TRUE,   exact_matches_only = TRUE,   apikey = deprecated() )

title: Search AlgaeBase for information about a genus of algae — get_algaebase_genus
text: genus genus name search (character string). parameter required. subscription_key character string containing API key accessing AlgaeBase API. default, key read environment variable ALGAEBASE_KEY. can provide key three ways: Directly parameter: get_algaebase_genus("Skeletonema", subscription_key = "your_key_here"). Temporarily session: Sys.setenv(ALGAEBASE_KEY = "your_key_here"). , need pass subscription_key function. Permanently across sessions adding ~/.Renviron file. Use usethis::edit_r_environ() open file, add: ALGAEBASE_KEY=your_key_here. , need pass subscription_key function. higher boolean flag indicating whether include higher taxonomy output (default TRUE). unparsed boolean flag indicating whether return raw JSON output API (default FALSE). newest_only boolean flag return recent entry (default TRUE). exact_matches_only boolean flag limit results exact matches (default TRUE). apikey Use subscription_key instead.

title: Search AlgaeBase for information about a genus of algae — get_algaebase_genus
text: data frame following columns: id — AlgaeBase identifier. accepted_name — Accepted scientific name (different input). input_name — genus name supplied user. input_match — Indicator exact match (1 = exact, 0 = exact). currently_accepted — Indicator taxon currently accepted (1 = TRUE, 0 = FALSE). genus_only — Indicator search genus (1 = genus, 0 = genus + species). kingdom, phylum, class, order, family — Higher taxonomy (returned higher = TRUE). taxonomic_status — Status taxon (e.g., currently accepted, synonym, unverified). taxon_rank — Taxonomic rank accepted name (e.g., genus, species). mod_date — Date entry last modified. long_name — Full scientific name including author date (available). authorship — Author information (available).

title: Search AlgaeBase for information about a genus of algae — get_algaebase_genus
text: valid API key requested AlgaeBase team.

title: Search AlgaeBase for information about a genus of algae — get_algaebase_genus
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   get_algaebase_genus("Anabaena", subscription_key = "your_api_key") } # }

what: Search AlgaeBase for information about a species of algae — get_algaebase_species
title: Search AlgaeBase for information about a species of algae — get_algaebase_species
text: function deprecated. Users encouraged use match_algaebase_species instead. function searches AlgaeBase API species based genus species names. allows flexible search parameters filtering exact matches, returning recent results, including higher taxonomy details.

title: Search AlgaeBase for information about a species of algae — get_algaebase_species
code: get_algaebase_species(   genus,   species,   subscription_key = Sys.getenv("ALGAEBASE_KEY"),   higher = TRUE,   unparsed = FALSE,   newest_only = TRUE,   exact_matches_only = TRUE,   apikey = deprecated() )

title: Search AlgaeBase for information about a species of algae — get_algaebase_species
text: genus character string specifying genus name. species character string specifying species specific epithet. subscription_key character string containing API key accessing AlgaeBase API. default, key read environment variable ALGAEBASE_KEY. can provide key three ways: Directly parameter: get_algaebase_species("Skeletonema", "marinoi", subscription_key = "your_key_here"). Temporarily session: Sys.setenv(ALGAEBASE_KEY = "your_key_here"). , need pass subscription_key function. Permanently across sessions adding ~/.Renviron file. Use usethis::edit_r_environ() open file, add: ALGAEBASE_KEY=your_key_here. , need pass subscription_key function. higher logical value indicating whether include higher taxonomy details (default TRUE). unparsed logical value indicating whether print full JSON response API (default FALSE). newest_only logical value indicating whether return recent entries (default TRUE). exact_matches_only logical value indicating whether return exact matches (default TRUE). apikey Use subscription_key instead.

title: Search AlgaeBase for information about a species of algae — get_algaebase_species
text: data frame details species, including: taxonomic_status — current status taxon (e.g., accepted, synonym, unverified). taxon_rank — rank taxon (e.g., species, genus). accepted_name — currently accepted scientific name, applicable. authorship — Author information scientific name (available). mod_date — Date taxonomic record last modified. ... — relevant information returned data source.

title: Search AlgaeBase for information about a species of algae — get_algaebase_species
text: valid API key requested AlgaeBase team. function queries AlgaeBase API species based genus species names, filters results based various parameters. function handles different taxonomic ranks formats output easy use. can merge higher taxonomy data requested.

title: Search AlgaeBase for information about a species of algae — get_algaebase_species
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Search for a species with exact matches only, return the most recent results result <- get_algaebase_species(   genus = "Skeletonema", species = "marinoi", subscription_key = "your_api_key" )  # Print result print(result) } # }

what: Get a delivery template for a SHARK datatype — get_delivery_template
title: Get a delivery template for a SHARK datatype — get_delivery_template
text: Downloads reads SHARK Excel delivery template given datatype. template contains column definitions headers used submission.

title: Get a delivery template for a SHARK datatype — get_delivery_template
code: get_delivery_template(   datatype,   sheet = "Kolumner",   header_row = 4,   skip = 1,   bacterioplankton_subtype = "abundance",   force = FALSE,   clean_cache_days = 1 )

title: Get a delivery template for a SHARK datatype — get_delivery_template
text: datatype Character. datatype name. Available options include: "Bacterioplankton" (subtypes: "abundance", "production") "Chlorophyll" "Epibenthos" (dive transect) "Dropvideo" (epibenthos drop video) "Grey seal" "Harbour seal" "Ringed seal" "Harbour Porpoise" "Physical Chemical" "Primary production" "Phytoplankton" "Picoplankton" "Sedimentation" "Seal pathology" "Profile" "Zooplankton" "Zoobenthos" sheet Character numeric. Name (e.g., "Kolumner") index (e.g., 1) sheet Excel file read. Default "Kolumner". header_row Integer. Row number Excel file contains column headers. Default 4. skip Integer. Number rows skip reading data. Default 1. bacterioplankton_subtype Character. "Bacterioplankton" : either "abundance" (default) "production". Ignored datatypes. force Logical; TRUE, forces re-download even cached copy exists. clean_cache_days Numeric; NULL, cached template files older number days deleted automatically. Default 1.

title: Get a delivery template for a SHARK datatype — get_delivery_template
text: tibble containing delivery template. Column names set header row.

title: Get a delivery template for a SHARK datatype — get_delivery_template

what: Download and read Darwin Core Archive files from Dyntaxa — get_dyntaxa_dwca
title: Download and read Darwin Core Archive files from Dyntaxa — get_dyntaxa_dwca
text: function downloads complete Darwin Core Archive (DwCA) Dyntaxa SLU Artdatabanken API, extracts archive, reads specified CSV file R.

title: Download and read Darwin Core Archive files from Dyntaxa — get_dyntaxa_dwca
code: get_dyntaxa_dwca(   subscription_key = Sys.getenv("DYNTAXA_KEY"),   file_to_read = "Taxon.csv",   force = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Download and read Darwin Core Archive files from Dyntaxa — get_dyntaxa_dwca
text: subscription_key Dyntaxa API subscription key. default, key read environment variable DYNTAXA_KEY. can provide key three ways: Directly parameter: get_dyntaxa_dwca(subscription_key = "your_key_here"). Temporarily session: Sys.setenv(DYNTAXA_KEY = "your_key_here"). , need pass subscription_key function. Permanently across sessions adding ~/.Renviron file. Use usethis::edit_r_environ() open file, add: DYNTAXA_KEY=your_key_here. , need pass subscription_key function. file_to_read string specifying name CSV file read extracted archive. Allowed options : "Reference.csv", "SpeciesDistribution.csv", "Taxon.csv", "VernacularName.csv". Defaults "Taxon.csv". force logical value indicating whether force fresh download archive, even cached copy available. Defaults FALSE. verbose logical value indicating whether show download progress. Defaults TRUE.

title: Download and read Darwin Core Archive files from Dyntaxa — get_dyntaxa_dwca
text: tibble containing data specified CSV file.

title: Download and read Darwin Core Archive files from Dyntaxa — get_dyntaxa_dwca
text: default, archive downloaded cached across R sessions. subsequent calls, function reuses cached copy extracted files avoid repeated downloads. Use force parameter re-download archive needed. cache cleared automatically 24 hours, can also manually clear using clean_shark4r_cache. valid Dyntaxa API subscription key required. can request free key "Taxonomy" service ArtDatabanken API portal: https://api-portal.artdatabanken.se/ Note: Please review API conditions register access using API. Data collected API stored SLU Artdatabanken. Please also note authors SHARK4R affiliated SLU Artdatabanken.

title: Download and read Darwin Core Archive files from Dyntaxa — get_dyntaxa_dwca
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Provide your Dyntaxa API subscription key subscription_key <- "your_subscription_key"  # Download and read the Taxon.csv file taxon_data <- get_dyntaxa_dwca(subscription_key, file_to_read = "Taxon.csv") } # }

what: Get parent taxon IDs for specified taxon IDs from Dyntaxa — get_dyntaxa_parent_ids
title: Get parent taxon IDs for specified taxon IDs from Dyntaxa — get_dyntaxa_parent_ids
text: function queries SLU Artdatabanken API (Dyntaxa) retrieve parent taxon IDs specified taxon IDs. constructs request provided taxon IDs, sends request SLU Artdatabanken API, processes response return list parent taxon IDs.

title: Get parent taxon IDs for specified taxon IDs from Dyntaxa — get_dyntaxa_parent_ids
code: get_dyntaxa_parent_ids(   taxon_ids,   subscription_key = Sys.getenv("DYNTAXA_KEY"),   verbose = TRUE )

title: Get parent taxon IDs for specified taxon IDs from Dyntaxa — get_dyntaxa_parent_ids
text: taxon_ids vector numeric taxon IDs parent taxon IDs requested. subscription_key Dyntaxa API subscription key. default, key read environment variable DYNTAXA_KEY. can provide key three ways: Directly parameter: get_dyntaxa_parent_ids(238366, subscription_key = "your_key_here"). Temporarily session: Sys.setenv(DYNTAXA_KEY = "your_key_here"). , need pass subscription_key function. Permanently across sessions adding ~/.Renviron file. Use usethis::edit_r_environ() open file, add: DYNTAXA_KEY=your_key_here. , need pass subscription_key function. verbose Logical. Default TRUE.

title: Get parent taxon IDs for specified taxon IDs from Dyntaxa — get_dyntaxa_parent_ids
text: list containing parent taxon IDs corresponding specified taxon IDs.

title: Get parent taxon IDs for specified taxon IDs from Dyntaxa — get_dyntaxa_parent_ids
text: valid Dyntaxa API subscription key required. can request free key "Taxonomy" service ArtDatabanken API portal: https://api-portal.artdatabanken.se/ Note: Please review API conditions register access using API. Data collected API stored SLU Artdatabanken. Please also note authors SHARK4R affiliated SLU Artdatabanken.

title: Get parent taxon IDs for specified taxon IDs from Dyntaxa — get_dyntaxa_parent_ids
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get parent taxon IDs for taxon IDs 238366 and 1010380 parent_ids <- get_dyntaxa_parent_ids(c(238366, 1010380), "your_subscription_key") print(parent_ids) } # }

what: Download the IOC-UNESCO Taxonomic Reference List of Harmful Micro Algae — get_hab_list
title: Download the IOC-UNESCO Taxonomic Reference List of Harmful Micro Algae — get_hab_list
text: function retrieves IOC-UNESCO Taxonomic Reference List Harmful Micro Algae World Register Marine Species (WoRMS). data returned dataframe, options customize fields included download.

title: Download the IOC-UNESCO Taxonomic Reference List of Harmful Micro Algae — get_hab_list
code: get_hab_list(   aphia_id = TRUE,   scientific_name = TRUE,   authority = TRUE,   fossil = TRUE,   rank_name = TRUE,   status_name = TRUE,   qualitystatus_name = TRUE,   modified = TRUE,   lsid = TRUE,   parent_id = TRUE,   stored_path = TRUE,   citation = TRUE,   classification = TRUE,   environment = TRUE,   accepted_taxon = TRUE )

title: Download the IOC-UNESCO Taxonomic Reference List of Harmful Micro Algae — get_hab_list
text: aphia_id Logical. Include AphiaID field. Defaults TRUE. scientific_name Logical. Include scientific name field. Defaults TRUE. authority Logical. Include authority field. Defaults TRUE. fossil Logical. Include information fossil status. Defaults TRUE. rank_name Logical. Include taxonomic rank (e.g., species, variety, forma). Defaults TRUE. status_name Logical. Include taxonomic status field. Defaults TRUE. qualitystatus_name Logical. Include quality status field. Defaults TRUE. modified Logical. Include date last modification field. Defaults TRUE. lsid Logical. Include Life Science Identifier (LSID) field. Defaults TRUE. parent_id Logical. Include parent AphiaID field. Defaults TRUE. stored_path Logical. Include stored path field. Defaults TRUE. citation Logical. Include citation information. Defaults TRUE. classification Logical. Include full taxonomic classification (e.g., kingdom, phylum, class). Defaults TRUE. environment Logical. Include environmental data (e.g., marine, brackish, freshwater, terrestrial). Defaults TRUE. accepted_taxon Logical. Include information accepted taxon (e.g., scientific name authority). Defaults TRUE.

title: Download the IOC-UNESCO Taxonomic Reference List of Harmful Micro Algae — get_hab_list
text: tibble containing HABs taxonomic list, columns based selected parameters.

title: Download the IOC-UNESCO Taxonomic Reference List of Harmful Micro Algae — get_hab_list

what: Get the latest NOMP biovolume Excel list — get_nomp_list
title: Get the latest NOMP biovolume Excel list — get_nomp_list
text: function downloads latest available Nordic Marine Phytoplankton Group (NOMP) biovolume zip archive SMHI, unzips , reads first Excel file default. can also specify file archive read.

title: Get the latest NOMP biovolume Excel list — get_nomp_list
code: get_nomp_list(   year = as.numeric(format(Sys.Date(), "%Y")),   file = NULL,   sheet = NULL,   force = FALSE,   base_url = NULL,   clean_cache_days = 30,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Get the latest NOMP biovolume Excel list — get_nomp_list
text: year Numeric year download. Default current year; available, previous years automatically tried. file Character string specifying file zip archive read. Defaults first Excel file archive. sheet Character numeric; name index sheet read Excel file. neither argument specifies sheet, defaults first sheet. force Logical; TRUE, forces re-download zip file even cached copy exists. base_url Base URL (without "/nomp_taxa_biovolumes_and_carbon_YYYY.zip") NOMP biovolume files. Defaults SMHI directory. clean_cache_days Numeric; NULL, cached NOMP zip files older number days automatically deleted replaced new download. Defaults 30. Set NULL disable automatic cleanup. verbose logical indicating whether print progress messages. Default TRUE.

title: Get the latest NOMP biovolume Excel list — get_nomp_list
text: tibble contents requested Excel file.

title: Get the latest NOMP biovolume Excel list — get_nomp_list
code: # \donttest{   # Get the latest available list   nomp_list <- get_nomp_list() #> File for year 2025 not available. what: Retrieve external links or facts for taxa from Nordic Microalgae — get_nua_external_links
title: Retrieve external links or facts for taxa from Nordic Microalgae — get_nua_external_links
text: function retrieves external links related algae taxa Nordic Microalgae API. takes vector slugs (taxon identifiers) returns data frame containing external links associated taxon. data includes provider, label, external ID, URL external link.

code: get_nua_external_links(slug, verbose = TRUE, unparsed = FALSE)

text: unparsed = FALSE: tibble containing following columns: slug slug (identifier) taxon. provider provider external link. label label external link. external_id external ID associated external link. external_url URL external link. collection collection category, "External Links" rows.

what: Retrieve tabular data from SHARK — get_shark_data
title: Retrieve tabular data from SHARK — get_shark_data
text: get_shark_data() function retrieves tabular data SHARK database hosted SMHI. function sends POST request SHARK API customizable filters, including year, month, taxon name, water category, , returns retrieved data structured tibble. view available filter options, see get_shark_options.

title: Retrieve tabular data from SHARK — get_shark_data
code: get_shark_data(   tableView = "sharkweb_overview",   headerLang = "internal_key",   save_data = FALSE,   file_path = NULL,   delimiters = "point-tab",   lineEnd = "win",   encoding = "utf_8",   dataTypes = c(),   bounds = c(),   fromYear = NULL,   toYear = NULL,   months = c(),   parameters = c(),   checkStatus = "",   qualityFlags = c(),   deliverers = c(),   orderers = c(),   projects = c(),   datasets = c(),   minSamplingDepth = "",   maxSamplingDepth = "",   redListedCategory = c(),   taxonName = c(),   stationName = c(),   vattenDistrikt = c(),   seaBasins = c(),   counties = c(),   municipalities = c(),   waterCategories = c(),   typOmraden = c(),   helcomOspar = c(),   seaAreas = c(),   hideEmptyColumns = FALSE,   row_limit = 10^7,   prod = TRUE,   utv = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Retrieve tabular data from SHARK — get_shark_data
text: tableView Character. Specifies columns table retrieve. Options include: "sharkweb_overview": Overview table "sharkweb_all": available columns "sharkdata_bacterioplankton": Bacterioplankton table "sharkdata_chlorophyll": Chlorophyll table "sharkdata_epibenthos": Epibenthos table "sharkdata_greyseal": Greyseal table "sharkdata_harbourporpoise": Harbour porpoise table "sharkdata_harbourseal": Harbour seal table "sharkdata_jellyfish": Jellyfish table "sharkdata_physicalchemical": Physical chemical table "sharkdata_physicalchemical_columns": Physical chemical table: column view "sharkdata_phytoplankton": Phytoplankton table "sharkdata_picoplankton": Picoplankton table "sharkdata_planktonbarcoding": Plankton barcoding table "sharkdata_primaryproduction": Primary production table "sharkdata_ringedseal": Ringed seal table "sharkdata_sealpathology": Seal pathology table "sharkdata_sedimentation": Sedimentation table "sharkdata_zoobenthos": Zoobenthos table "sharkdata_zooplankton": Zooplankton table "report_sum_year_param": Report sum per year parameter "report_sum_year_param_taxon": Report sum per year, parameter taxon "report_sampling_per_station": Report sampling per station "report_obs_taxon": Report observed taxa "report_stations": Report stations "report_taxon": Report taxa Default "sharkweb_overview". headerLang Character. Language option column headers. Possible values: "sv": Swedish. "en": English. "short": Shortened version. "internal_key": Internal key (default). save_data Logical. TRUE, downloaded data written file_path disk. FALSE (default), data temporarily written file read memory data.frame, temporary file deleted. file_path Character. file path data saved. Required save_data TRUE. Ignored save_data FALSE. delimiters Character. Specifies delimiter used separate values file, save_data TRUE. Options "point-tab" (tab-separated) "point-semi" (semicolon-separated). Default "point-tab". lineEnd Character. Defines type line endings file, save_data TRUE. Options "win" (Windows-style, \r\n) "unix" (Unix-style, \n). Default "win". encoding Character. Sets file's text encoding, save_data TRUE. Options "cp1252", "utf_8", "utf_16", "latin_1". Default "utf_8". dataTypes Character vector. Specifies data types filter. Possible values include: "Bacterioplankton" "Chlorophyll" "Epibenthos" "Grey seal" "Harbour Porpoise" "Harbour seal" "Jellyfish" "Physical Chemical" "Phytoplankton" "Picoplankton" "PlanktonBarcoding" "Primary production" "Profile" "Ringed seal" "Seal pathology" "Sedimentation" "Zoobenthos" "Zooplankton" bounds numeric vector length 4 specifying geographical search boundaries decimal degrees, formatted c(lon_min, lat_min, lon_max, lat_max), e.g., c(11, 58, 12, 59). Default c() include data. fromYear Integer (optional). starting year data retrieval. set NULL (default), function use earliest available year SHARK. toYear Integer (optional). ending year data retrieval. set NULL (default), function use latest available year SHARK. months Integer vector. months retrieve data , e.g., c(4, 5, 6) April June. parameters Character vector. Optional parameters filter results , "Chlorophyll-". checkStatus Character string. Optional status check filter results. qualityFlags Character vector. Specifies quality flags filter data. default, data included, including "B" flag (Bad). deliverers Character vector. Specifies data deliverers filter . orderers Character vector. Orderers filter specific organizations individuals. projects Character vector. Projects filter data specific research monitoring projects. datasets Character vector. Datasets filter data specific datasets. minSamplingDepth Numeric. Minimum sampling depth (meters) filter data. maxSamplingDepth Numeric. Maximum sampling depth (meters) filter data. redListedCategory Character vector. Red-listed taxa conservation filtering. taxonName Character vector. Optional vector taxa names filter . stationName Character vector. Station names filter data specific stations. vattenDistrikt Character vector. Water district names filter Swedish water districts. seaBasins Character vector. Sea basins filter . counties Character vector. Counties filter specific administrative regions. municipalities Character vector. Municipalities filter . waterCategories Character vector. Water categories filter . typOmraden Character vector. Type areas filter . helcomOspar Character vector. HELCOM OSPAR areas regional filtering. seaAreas Character vector. Sea area codes filter specific sea areas. hideEmptyColumns Logical. Whether hide empty columns. Default FALSE. row_limit Numeric. Specifies maximum number rows can retrieved single request. requested data exceeds limit, function automatically downloads data yearly chunks (ignored tableView = "report_*"). default value 10 million rows. prod Logical, whether download production (TRUE, default) test (FALSE) SHARK server. Ignored utv TRUE. utv Logical. Select UTV server TRUE. verbose Logical. Whether display progress information. Default TRUE.

title: Retrieve tabular data from SHARK — get_shark_data
text: tibble containing retrieved SHARK data, parsed API's delimited text response. Column types inferred automatically.

title: Retrieve tabular data from SHARK — get_shark_data
text: function sends POST request SHARK API specified filters. API returns delimited text file (e.g., tab- semicolon-separated), downloaded read R tibble. row_limit parameter exceeded, data retrieved yearly chunks combined single table. Adjusting row_limit parameter may necessary retrieving large datasets detailed reports. Note making large requests (e.g., retrieving entire SHARK database) can extremely time- memory-intensive.

title: Retrieve tabular data from SHARK — get_shark_data
text: large queries spanning multiple years including several data types, retrieval can time-consuming memory-intensive. Consider filtering year, data type, region improved performance.

title: Retrieve tabular data from SHARK — get_shark_data
code: # \donttest{   # Retrieve chlorophyll data from 2019 to 2020 for April to June   shark_data <- get_shark_data(fromYear = 2019, toYear = 2020,                                months = c(4, 5, 6), dataTypes = "Chlorophyll",                                verbose = FALSE)   print(shark_data) #> # A tibble: 179 × 72 #>    delivery_datatype check_status_sv data_checked_by_sv visit_year visit_month #>    <chr>             <chr>           <chr>                   <dbl>       <dbl> #>  1 Chlorophyll       Klar            Leverantör               2020           6 #>  2 Chlorophyll       Klar            Leverantör               2020           6 #>  3 Chlorophyll       Klar            Leverantör               2020           6 #>  4 Chlorophyll       Klar            Leverantör               2020           6 #>  5 Chlorophyll       Klar            Leverantör               2020           6 #>  6 Chlorophyll       Klar            Leverantör               2020           6 #>  7 Chlorophyll       Klar            Leverantör               2020           6 #>  8 Chlorophyll       Klar            Leverantör               2020           6 #>  9 Chlorophyll       Klar            Leverantör               2020           6 #> 10 Chlorophyll       Klar            Leverantör               2020           6 #> # ℹ 169 more rows #> # ℹ 67 more variables: station_name <chr>, reported_station_name <chr>, #> #   sample_location_id <dbl>, station_id <dbl>, sample_project_name_sv <lgl>, #> #   sample_orderer_name_sv <lgl>, visit_id <dbl>, visit_date <lgl>, #> #   shark_sample_id_md5 <chr>, sample_date <date>, sample_time <time>, #> #   sample_enddate <lgl>, sample_endtime <lgl>, sample_latitude_dm <chr>, #> #   sample_longitude_dm <chr>, sample_latitude_dd <dbl>, … # }

what: Download SHARK dataset zip archives — get_shark_datasets
title: Download SHARK dataset zip archives — get_shark_datasets
text: Downloads one datasets (zip-archives) SHARK database (Swedish national marine environmental data archive) optionally unzips . function matches provided dataset names available SHARK datasets.

title: Download SHARK dataset zip archives — get_shark_datasets
code: get_shark_datasets(   dataset_name,   save_dir = NULL,   prod = TRUE,   utv = FALSE,   unzip_file = FALSE,   return_df = FALSE,   encoding = "latin_1",   guess_encoding = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Download SHARK dataset zip archives — get_shark_datasets
text: dataset_name Character vector one dataset names (partial names). entry matched available SHARK dataset identifiers (e.g., "SHARK_Phytoplankton_2023_SMHI_BVVF" specific dataset, "SHARK_Phytoplankton" Phytoplankton datasets). save_dir Directory zip files (optionally extracted contents) stored. Defaults NULL. NULL "", temporary directory used. prod Logical, whether download production (TRUE, default) test (FALSE) SHARK server. Ignored utv TRUE. utv Logical. Select UTV server TRUE. unzip_file Logical, whether extract downloaded zip archives (TRUE) save (FALSE, default). return_df Logical, whether return combined data frame contents downloaded datasets (TRUE) instead list file paths (FALSE, default). encoding Character. File encoding shark_data.txt. Options: "cp1252", "utf_8", "utf_16", "latin_1". Default "latin_1". guess_encoding = TRUE, detected encoding overrides value. Ignored return_df FALSE. guess_encoding Logical. TRUE (default), automatically detect file encoding. FALSE, function uses user-specified encoding. Ignored return_df FALSE. verbose Logical, whether show download extraction progress messages. Default TRUE.

title: Download SHARK dataset zip archives — get_shark_datasets
text: return_df = FALSE, named list character vectors. element corresponds one matched dataset contains either path downloaded zip file (unzip_file = FALSE) path extraction directory (unzip_file = TRUE). return_df = TRUE, single combined data frame dataset contents, including source column indicating dataset.

title: Download SHARK dataset zip archives — get_shark_datasets
code: # \donttest{ # Get a specific dataset get_shark_datasets("SHARK_Phytoplankton_2023_SMHI_BVVF", verbose = FALSE) #> $`SHARK_Phytoplankton_2023_SMHI_BVVF_version_2025-03-09.zip` #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpWnWKWd/SHARK_Phytoplankton_2023_SMHI_BVVF_version_2025-03-09.zip" #>   # Get all Zooplankton datasets from 2022 and unzip them get_shark_datasets(   dataset_name = "Zooplankton_2022",   unzip_file = TRUE,   verbose = FALSE ) #> $`SHARK_Zooplankton_2022_DEEP_version_2024-12-17.zip` #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpWnWKWd/SHARK_Zooplankton_2022_DEEP_version_2024-12-17" #>  #> $`SHARK_Zooplankton_2022_SMHI_version_2024-12-17.zip` #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpWnWKWd/SHARK_Zooplankton_2022_SMHI_version_2024-12-17" #>  #> $`SHARK_Zooplankton_2022_UMSC_version_2024-03-27.zip` #> [1] "/tmp/RtmpWnWKWd/SHARK_Zooplankton_2022_UMSC_version_2024-03-27" #>   # Get all Chlorophyll datasets and return as a combined data frame combined_df <- get_shark_datasets(   dataset_name = "Chlorophyll",   return_df = TRUE,   verbose = FALSE ) #> Detected encoding 'windows-1252' differs from specified 'latin_1'. Using detected encoding. head(combined_df) #> # A tibble: 6 × 73 #>   source delivery_datatype check_status_sv data_checked_by_sv visit_year #>    <dbl> <chr>             <chr>           <chr>                   <dbl> #> 1      1 Chlorophyll       Klar            Leverantör               1989 #> 2      1 Chlorophyll       Klar            Leverantör               1989 #> 3      1 Chlorophyll       Klar            Leverantör               1985 #> 4      1 Chlorophyll       Klar            Leverantör               1989 #> 5      1 Chlorophyll       Klar            Leverantör               1989 #> 6      1 Chlorophyll       Klar            Leverantör               1989 #> # ℹ 68 more variables: visit_month <dbl>, station_name <chr>, #> #   reported_station_name <chr>, sample_location_id <dbl>, station_id <dbl>, #> #   sample_project_name_en <chr>, sample_orderer_name_en <chr>, #> #   platform_code <chr>, visit_id <chr>, expedition_id <chr>, #> #   shark_sample_id_md5 <chr>, sample_date <date>, sample_time <time>, #> #   sample_enddate <date>, sample_endtime <lgl>, sample_latitude_dm <chr>, #> #   sample_longitude_dm <chr>, sample_latitude_dd <dbl>, … # }

what: Retrieve available search options from SHARK — get_shark_options
title: Retrieve available search options from SHARK — get_shark_options
text: get_shark_options() function retrieves available search options SHARK database. sends GET request SHARK API returns results structured named list.

title: Retrieve available search options from SHARK — get_shark_options
code: get_shark_options(prod = TRUE, utv = FALSE, unparsed = FALSE)

title: Retrieve available search options from SHARK — get_shark_options
text: prod Logical value selects production server TRUE test server FALSE, unless utv TRUE. utv Logical value selects UTV server TRUE. unparsed Logical. TRUE, returns complete JSON response nested list without parsing. Defaults FALSE.

title: Retrieve available search options from SHARK — get_shark_options
text: named list available search options SHARK API. unparsed = TRUE, returns raw JSON structure list.

title: Retrieve available search options from SHARK — get_shark_options
text: function sends GET request /api/options endpoint SHARK API retrieve available search filters options can used SHARK data queries.

title: Retrieve available search options from SHARK — get_shark_options
code: # \donttest{   # Retrieve available search options (simplified)   shark_options <- get_shark_options()   names(shark_options) #>  [1] "datasets"              "dataTypes"             "parameters"            #>  [4] "minYear"               "maxYear"               "months"                #>  [7] "checkStatuses"         "qualityFlags"          "deliverers"            #> [10] "orderers"              "projects"              "redListedCategories"   #> [13] "taxa"                  "stations"              "seaAreas"              #> [16] "vattenDistrikt"        "typOmraden"            "seaBasins"             #> [19] "counties"              "municipalities"        "waterCategories"       #> [22] "helcomOspar"           "parametersForDatatype" "headerlangers"         #> [25] "minYearPerDatatype"       # Retrieve full unparsed JSON response   raw_options <- get_shark_options(unparsed = TRUE)    # View available datatypes   print(shark_options$dataTypes) #>  [1] "Bacterioplankton"      "Chlorophyll"           "Epibenthos"            #>  [4] "Grey seal"             "Harbour Porpoise"      "Harbour seal"          #>  [7] "Physical and Chemical" "Phytoplankton"         "Picoplankton"          #> [10] "Plankton Barcoding"    "Plankton Imaging"      "Primary production"    #> [13] "Profile"               "Ringed seal"           "Seal pathology"        #> [16] "Sedimentation"         "Zoobenthos"            "Zooplankton"           # }

what: Summarize numeric SHARK parameters with ranges and outlier thresholds — get_shark_statistics
title: Summarize numeric SHARK parameters with ranges and outlier thresholds — get_shark_statistics
text: Downloads SHARK data given time period, filters numeric parameters, calculates descriptive statistics Tukey outlier thresholds.

title: Summarize numeric SHARK parameters with ranges and outlier thresholds — get_shark_statistics
code: get_shark_statistics(   fromYear = NULL,   toYear = NULL,   datatype = NULL,   group_col = NULL,   min_obs = 3,   max_non_numeric_frac = 0.05,   cache_result = FALSE,   prod = TRUE,   utv = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Summarize numeric SHARK parameters with ranges and outlier thresholds — get_shark_statistics
text: fromYear Start year download (numeric). Defaults 5 years last complete year. toYear End year download (numeric). Defaults last complete year. datatype Optional, one datatypes filter (e.g. "Bacterioplankton"). NULL, datatypes included. group_col Optional column name SHARK data group (e.g. "station_name"). provided, statistics computed separately group. Default NULL. min_obs Minimum number numeric observations required parameter included (default: 3). max_non_numeric_frac Maximum allowed fraction non-numeric values parameter kept (default: 0.05). cache_result Logical, whether save result persistent cache (statistics.rds) use functions. Default FALSE. prod Logical, whether download production (TRUE, default) test (FALSE) SHARK server. Ignored utv TRUE. utv Logical. Select UTV server TRUE. verbose Logical, whether show download progress messages. Default TRUE.

title: Summarize numeric SHARK parameters with ranges and outlier thresholds — get_shark_statistics
text: tibble one row per parameter (optionally per group) following columns: parameter Parameter name (character). datatype SHARK datatype (character). min, Q1, median, Q3, max Observed quantiles. P01, P05, P95, P99 1st, 5th, 95th 99th percentiles. IQR Interquartile range. mean Arithmetic mean numeric values. sd Standard deviation numeric values. var Variance numeric values. cv Coefficient variation (sd / mean). mad Median absolute deviation. mild_lower, mild_upper Lower/upper bounds mild outliers (1.5 × IQR). extreme_lower, extreme_upper Lower/upper bounds extreme outliers (3 × IQR). n Number numeric observations used. fromYear First year included SHARK data download (numeric). toYear Last year included SHARK data download (numeric). <group_col> Optional grouping column provided.

title: Summarize numeric SHARK parameters with ranges and outlier thresholds — get_shark_statistics
text: default, function uses previous five complete years. example, called 2025 use data 2020–2024.

title: Summarize numeric SHARK parameters with ranges and outlier thresholds — get_shark_statistics
code: # \donttest{ # Uses previous 5 years automatically, Chlorophyll data only res <- get_shark_statistics(datatype = "Chlorophyll", verbose = FALSE) print(res) #> # A tibble: 1 × 24 #>   parameter  datatype fromYear toYear     n   min    Q1 median    Q3   max   P01 #>   <chr>      <chr>       <dbl>  <dbl> <int> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 Chlorophy… Chlorop…     2020   2024  1374  0.19  1.39    2.2   3.3  22.2 0.307 #> # ℹ 13 more variables: P05 <dbl>, P95 <dbl>, P99 <dbl>, IQR <dbl>, mean <dbl>, #> #   sd <dbl>, var <dbl>, cv <dbl>, mad <dbl>, mild_lower <dbl>, #> #   mild_upper <dbl>, extreme_lower <dbl>, extreme_upper <dbl>  # Group by station name and save result in persistent cache res_station <- get_shark_statistics(datatype = "Chlorophyll",                                     group_col = "station_name",                                     cache_result = TRUE,                                     verbose = FALSE) print(res_station) #> #
